consensus_text: Dedicated teams initially to build capacity and establish standards
Followed by integration into everyone's responsibilities
Through performance frameworks cultural change and standardized measurement
Responsibility is diffused without clear mechanisms for implementation
While participants agree everyone should ultimately be responsible
This creates accountability gaps in practice
Sustainability efforts lack coordination with fragmented approaches
No standardized framework for measurement or reporting
Management prioritizes financial metrics over environmental ones
Individual contributors lack clear guidance on sustainable practices

Teams gather information establish workflows create measurement frameworks
Build capacity and spread knowledge until embedded in culture
Sustainability metrics integrated into senior leadership KPIs
Legal incentives needed to shift management mindset
Open standardized frameworks for measuring and reporting
Start conversations in teams about sustainability trade-offs in code reviews
Use initial dedicated team successes as examples to spread practices
Incorporate green targets into existing performance frameworks
Begin with focused teams to establish foundation and tools
Transition toward distributed responsibility once cultural shift achieved
Responsibility should ultimately be distributed across all roles
Requires foundational work first
Current fragmentation blocks progress
Standardized measurement frameworks are essential
Management mindset change necessary driven by legal incentives and KPIs

Sustainability integrated into daily work like code reviews and design
Becoming part of core organizational culture not separate initiatives
Some emphasize immediate integration to avoid friction of dedicated teams
Separate roles lead to go speak to our green guy dynamics

To establish expertise tools and workflows before broader distribution
